title: Let's deploy this - call for consortium

labels.name: deployment
labels.description: deploying it - infrastructure, ci, docker etc

body: Who is interested in running a consortium of communities running this chain? Please post here, would be great if you could also give a one-liner, what your community is about.

title: switch to regular email system
body: [lettre](https://lettre.at) seems quite good. let's replace our current http-driven-email-system with a regular email sending using that.

title: single entrypoint docker-compose
body:
- [ ] a slim `Dockerfile` to put the entire build (binary & JS build) into
- [ ] a `docker-compose.yml`, that uses the docker-image and provides a single http-endpoint (potentially with an nginx in front) to
  1. [ ] host and serve the static-html
  2. [ ] allow access to the JSON-RPC 
  3. [ ] pass-through to the websocket

title: autodeploying CI

labels.name: deployment
labels.description: deploying it - infrastructure, ci, docker etc

body: would love some CI, especially on that would install on the server after merge.

title: login via other external accounts
body:
refs #20 

can we allow to login via facebook / google / github / whatever ?

title: research better login patterns
body: The current system uses email+pw as mnemonic phrases to generate the keypair. But todays humans are used to forgetting their password and then having capabilities to recover or reset it. We should investigate what is necessary to implement something like this.

title: import upcoming events from meetup.com
body:
Would be great to wire up the UI to allow organisers to import their existing upcoming meetup.com events as events on the chain.

:100: :+1: if you use the API/verification-flow not only to import the event, but automatically close RSVPs and put a link to the new events in the description and tell people to sign up here :D .

title: Adding tags
body:
discovery is key for the platform aspect. One of the key ways that discovery works is by allowing the user to set the tags and locations they are interested in and when new groups are created, matching these criteria, they receive a digest/direct notification (email).

This issue is about the tagging mechanism. In particular I expect:

 - a globally managed list of tags
 - tags<->groups relationship (to be set during "updated")
 - tags<->users relationship (new user-preferences?)

body:
